HEAD.title: Pennsylvania Spatial Data Access | Full Metadata

BODY.H2: PA City of Philadelphia LiDAR Project Spring 2008

DL.DD: PA City of Philadelphia LiDAR Project Spring 2008

DIV.PRE: LiDAR data collection performed over the City of Philadelphia, PA in April of 2008. Products generated include Breaklines, 10ft DEM and 5ft DEM.
The dataset was collected to be utilized in Orthorectification of the Ortho Mosaics and oblique delivery. Other uses expected.

DL.DT: Access_Constraints:Access to this data is constrained by the license agreements between Pictometry International and the City of Philadelphia, PA.

DIV.PRE: Use of this data is constrained by the license agreements between Pictometry International and the City of Philadelphia, PA.

DL.DT: Contact_Organization:Division of Technology, GIS Services Group

DL.DD: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770
PA City of Philadelphia LiDAR Project Spring 2010

DIV.PRE: Dataset is LiDAR data. Logical consistency is not applicable.
The 2010 City of Philadelphia, PA LiDAR dataset associated with this metadata file completely covers the project-specified boundary with no data voids caused by acquisition or sensor issues.

DL.DD: PA City of Philadelphia LiDAR Project Spring 2010

DIV.PRE: Data Collection: Performed by Pictometry International's Optech ALTM Gemini 3100 LiDAR system. Data was collected at a nominal post spacing of 1 meter over an area of approximately 191 square miles covering the City of Philadelphia, PA. The data was acquired over 1 mission on April 1st, 2 missions on April 2nd, 1 mission on April 3rd, 1 mission on April 5th, 1 mission on April 6th, 1 mission on April 7th and 1 mission on April 8th.

GPS/INS Processing: During the flight, GPS and INS data was logged on board the aircraft. Simultaneously, GPS data was logged by a stationary reference station on the ground. After completion of the flight, this data was post-processed using Applanix POSPac v4.4 to generate a smoothed best estimate trajectory (SBET).

DashMap/TerraSolid: The raw laser range data was combined with the SBET to create the raw point cloud using Optech's DashMap software package. Once the LAS point cloud is created, TerraSolid's TerraMatch software is used to measure and apply small adjustments to the system's orientation angles in order to ensure proper alignment of data between flight lines.

Data Classification: A series of automated algorithms were applied using TerraSolid to classify ground points. The results of these algorithms were reviewed using models created in TerraModeler to ensure the quality of the classification results.

DIV.PRE: Distribution of this dataset is constrained by the existing license agreement between the Pictometry International Corp. and the City of Philadelphia, PA.
